data.text: Looking for a Trailer for Mountain Bike
Hi, I am looking for bicycle trailer for MTB. Could you please suggest any? Any advice is appreciated :-)
My advice would be to take less stuff and not use a trailer.

data.author: Spike Soton

data.text: What kind of terrain do you intend to ride? How much do you want it to carry? I’ve got a bob yak16 which has been in action since 1996. I’ve used that trailer, panniers and rackless bikepacking setups. I have found that my trailer is a big headache off road when lifting my bike over an obstacle, crossing water, singletrack and weighs about 13lb EMPTY (which is about the weight of ALL of my gear before food and water on an off-road bike trip). Care looking at my gear that I bring significantly reduces the amount that i need to haul. I weigh EVERYTHING that I bring from bike shorts to my sleeping kit. A king size seatbag 25+ liter and big bags on the fork legs such as Roadrunner’s buoy bag at 7.75 liter each side allow a bit more capacity. I like my trailer for urban hauling but wouldn’t use it for a bike trip without a bunch of hesitation.
data.author: Mike Krasovec
